events.title: Return of Magellan's Expedition
events.description: The remaining ship of Ferdinand Magellan's expedition, the Victoria, returned to Spain, completing the first circumnavigation of the Earth.
events.significance: Marked the first successful circumnavigation, proving the world was round and connected by ocean routes.

events.title: Assassination of President William McKinley
events.description: U.S. President William McKinley was shot by anarchist Leon Czolgosz and died several days later.
events.significance: Led to the presidency of Theodore Roosevelt and changes in U.S. security and policy.

events.title: Munich Massacre Begins
events.description: Palestinian terrorists took Israeli athletes hostage at the Munich Olympics, leading to a deadly hostage crisis.
events.significance: One of the deadliest terrorist attacks in Olympic history, impacting future security measures.

events.title: Collapse of the Soviet Union Begins
events.description: The leaders of Russia, Ukraine, and Belarus signed the Belavezha Accords, declaring the Soviet Union effectively dissolved.
events.significance: Marked the official end of the USSR and the emergence of independent post-Soviet states.
